This is not Trump‚Äôs census to hijack. We fought and defeated his attempt to add a citizenship question & we will stop this latest attempt to suppress the count and scrawl anti-immigrant graffiti all over the #2020Census. 
 
We cannot be silenced or erased. We must #GetCounted.

For every 1% of the population missed in the #2020Census, NYC could lose nearly $7.3 MILLION in federal funding for public education & $3.7 MILLION per year for critical jobs programs.

#NY12 could lose $4 MILLION for our public schools over the next decade.

When it comes to responding to the #2020Census and the future of our communities, I know NYC can do better. 

Frankly we MUST do better.

More than 62% of households across the country have self-responded to the #2020Census. However, within New York State only 58% of households have self-responded. 
 
NYC is even further behind, with a response rate under 54%. In #NY12, just 52% of residents have responded so far.

All of this makes it more important than ever to ensure that every single person in New York City participates in the #2020Census and helps secure the future of our communities for the next ten years. 
 
But the data shows that lots of work remains.

This order is blatantly unconstitutional, illegal, and another sinister attempt by Trump to politicize the #2020census for his political gain.
 
And just last month, he appointed two partisan political operatives to positions at the Census Bureau that previously did not exist.

Make no mistake, the #2020Census has been under attack since the day President Trump took office. 
 
Last Tuesday, President Trump issued a memorandum seeking to remove undocumented immigrants from the congressional apportionment count.

A full, fair and accurate census is the cornerstone of a healthy, equitable, and inclusive democracy. 
 
Unfortunately, as we face a public health crisis, a global economic downturn, and attacks from the Trump Administration - a full and accurate #2020Census is in jeopardy.
